Augments the estimates DataFrame with additional date information.

  • dates – DataFrame containing additional date information.

initialize_dates(meta: DataFrame, start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp) → DataFrame[source]¶

Initializes a DataFrame with ‘pdl’ and default ‘start_date’ and ‘end_date’ based on conditions in the meta DataFrame.

Parameters:

meta – DataFrame containing metadata, including ‘pdl’, ‘Date_Releve’, and ‘Motif_Releve’.

Returns:

A DataFrame with ‘pdl’, ‘start_date’, and ‘end_date’ columns, initialized based on the meta DataFrame.

Bases: BaseEstimator

estimate_consumption(meta: DataFrame, index: DataFrame, consos: DataFrame, start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, dates: Optional[DataFrame] = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Estimates the total consumption per PDL for the specified period using the first and last occurrence.

Parameters:

  • self – Instance of the class.

  • meta – Metadata DataFrame.

  • index – Index DataFrame containing consumption data.

  • consos – Not used in this implementation.

  • start – The start date of the period.

  • end – The end date of the period.

  • dates – Optional DataFrame with additional date information.

Returns:

The total consumption for the specified period, on each PDL.

Return type:

pandas DataFrame

enedis_odoo_bridge.consumption_estimators.soustraction_estimator module¶

class enedis_odoo_bridge.consumption_estimators.soustraction_estimator.SoustractionEstimator[source]¶

Bases: BaseEstimator

estimate_consumption(meta: DataFrame, index: DataFrame, consos: DataFrame, start: Timestamp, end: Timestamp, dates: Optional[DataFrame] = None) → DataFrame[source]¶

Estimates the total consumption per PDL for the specified period.

Parameters:

  • self – Instance of the StrategyMinMax class.

  • data (pandas DataFrame) – The dataframe containing mesures.

  • start (pandas Timestamp) – The start date of the period.

  • end (pandas Timestamp) – The end date of the period.

Returns:

The total consumption for the specified period, on each

Return type:

pandas DataFrame

Note

Idée : On filtre les relevés de la période, avec Statut_Releve = ‘INITIAL’. On les regroupe par pdl, puis pour chaque groupe, on fait la différence entre le plus grand et le plus petit index pour chaque classe de conso.

Pour l’instant on ne vérifie rien. Voyons quelques cas : - Si pas de relevés Empty DataFrame - Si un seul relevé, conso = 0 Alors qu’il faudrait NaN. - Si plusieurs relevés, conso ok
